title: Ownership Structure of Brunswick Corp Stock

content.text: According to the latest available data, institutional investors hold a significant portion of Brunswick Corp stock. As of the most recent filing, institutional ownership stands at approximately X%. This indicates that large financial institutions, such as mutual funds, pension funds, and investment firms, have a substantial stake in the company.

Insider ownership refers to the shares of a company held by its executives, directors, and other individuals closely associated with the business. In the case of Brunswick Corp, insider ownership is reported to be approximately X%. This suggests that company insiders have a notable interest in the company's performance and success.

While specific details may vary, some of the major shareholders of Brunswick Corp stock include institutional investors such as X Fund, Y Asset Management, and Z Capital. These institutions hold significant positions in the company and play a crucial role in shaping its ownership structure and decision-making.

Apart from institutional investors and insiders, there are also individual retail investors who hold shares of Brunswick Corp stock. The ownership percentage of retail investors varies and can be influenced by factors such as market conditions and investor sentiment.

Beneficial ownership refers to the ultimate ownership of shares, even if held in the name of an intermediary or nominee. It is essential to note that beneficial ownership information may not be readily available or publicly disclosed for all shareholders.

The ownership structure of Brunswick Corp stock can change over time as institutions buy or sell shares and insiders modify their holdings. Regular filings with regulatory authorities, such as the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), provide updates on changes in ownership.

The ownership structure of a company, including the presence of institutional investors and insider ownership, can influence corporate governance practices and decision-making processes. It is crucial for investors to consider the ownership structure when evaluating a company's strategic direction and potential risks.

Institutional investors, insiders, and major shareholders play a significant role in the ownership structure of Brunswick Corp stock. Their collective holdings shape the overall ownership landscape and can impact the company's operations and direction.

news.headline: Brunswick Corporation Named by Newsweek Magazine as One of America’s Most Responsible Companies for Fourth Consecutive Year
news.summary: METTAWA, Ill., Dec. 06, 2023 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brunswick Corporation (NYSE:BC), the world’s largest marine technology company, has been named one of America’s Most Responsible Companies by Newsweek for the fourth consecutive year. From the thousands U.S. companies considered for this honor, only 600 made the Newsweek list of honorees.
